Database Models¶

This section documents the database models used in the project.

Customer Model¶

class database.models.Customer(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Represents a customer in the database.

id¶

Unique identifier for the customer.

Type:

int

full_name¶

Full name of the customer.

Type:

str

username¶

Unique username for the customer.

Type:

str

password¶

Password for the customer.

Type:

str

age¶

Age of the customer.

Type:

int

address¶

Address of the customer.

Type:

str

gender¶

Gender of the customer, can be ‘Male’, ‘Female’, or ‘Other’.

Type:

str

marital_status¶

Marital status of the customer, can be ‘Single’, ‘Married’, ‘Divorced’, or ‘Widowed’.

Type:

str

wallet_balance¶

Wallet balance of the customer, defaults to 0.0.

Type:

float

__init__(self, full_name, username, password, age=None, address=None, gender=None, marital_status=None)¶

Initializes a new customer instance.

address¶
age¶
full_name¶
gender¶
id¶
marital_status¶
password¶
query: t.ClassVar[Query]¶

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

username¶
wallet_balance¶

Inventory Model¶

class database.models.Inventory(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Represents an inventory item in the database.

id¶

Unique identifier for the inventory item.

Type:

int

name¶

Name of the item.

Type:

str

category¶

Category of the item (e.g., Food, Clothes, Electronics).

Type:

str

price¶

Price of the item.

Type:

float

description¶

Description of the item.

Type:

str

count¶

Number of items available in stock.

Type:

int

__init__(self, name, category, price, count, description=None)¶

Initializes a new inventory item instance.

category¶
count¶
description¶
id¶
name¶
price¶
query: t.ClassVar[Query]¶

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

Sale Model¶

class database.models.Sale(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Represents a sale transaction in the database.

id¶

Unique identifier for the sale transaction.

Type:

int

customer_id¶

Foreign key to the customer making the purchase.

Type:

int

inventory_id¶

Foreign key to the inventory item being purchased.

Type:

int

quantity¶

Number of items purchased.

Type:

int

sale_date¶

Date and time when the sale occurred, defaulted to the current time.

Type:

datetime

__init__(self, customer_id, inventory_id, quantity)¶

Initializes a new sale transaction instance.

customer_id¶
id¶
inventory_id¶
quantity¶
query: t.ClassVar[Query]¶

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

sale_date¶

Review Model¶

class database.models.Review(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Represents a product review submitted by a customer.

id¶

Unique identifier for the review.

Type:

int

customer_id¶

Foreign key to the customer submitting the review.

Type:

int

inventory_id¶

Foreign key to the inventory item being reviewed.

Type:

int

rating¶

Rating for the product (1 to 5).

Type:

int

comment¶

Review comment for the product.

Type:

str

status¶

Status of the review (‘Pending’, ‘Approved’, or ‘Rejected’), defaults to ‘Pending’.

Type:

str

review_date¶

Date and time when the review was submitted, defaulted to the current time.

Type:

datetime

__init__(self, customer_id, inventory_id, rating, comment=None, status='Pending')¶

Initializes a new review instance.

comment¶
customer_id¶
id¶
inventory_id¶
query: t.ClassVar[Query]¶

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

rating¶
review_date¶
status¶
